title: Does changing Trump's residence mean that he committed voter fraud in 2018 or 2020?
subtitle: In most states, the law provides for a broad interpretation of the term "residence" when it comes to elections.
author: Alex Kasprak
vclaim: Because United States President Donald Trump changed his legal residence to Mar Lago in 2018, he committed the crime of voter fraud either in the mid-term elections of 2018, or in the presidential elections of 2020, or both.
